byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Jason Rezaian, Washington Post reporter on trial in Iran on espionage charges, may have exacerbated his egregious circumstances by cultivating contacts with government sources; his contacts and outgoing personality put him under scrutiny from many rivals in power structure, where foreign journalists are frequently assumed to be spies.
lead_paragraph: The Washington Post correspondent, who is accused of espionage, may have aroused suspicion by gaining strong connections to Iranian sources, his friends and colleagues say.

headline.main: In Iran, Jason Rezaian’s Reporting Strengths Led to Suspicion, Then Detention
headline.print_headline: In Iran, a Reporter’s Skills Led to Suspicion, Then Detention
